moves.8... Nxc3: Rather tan retreat to QB4, Black exchanges.
moves.9... Qe8: Trying to sneak the Q out onto the K-side to harass my King.
moves.10. Bb2: Clearing the decks and connecting Rooks.
moves.10... Bd6: Taking advantage of the fact that PxB??? is momentarily impossible (... QxQ)
moves.12. Bxc6: Now Black must end up down a piece.
moves.12... dxc6: Choosing to trade off the Bishops.
moves.13. exd6: Concluding the win of a piece...
moves.14. Qxe8: Immediate pressure,and also swapping down and reducing Black's chance for counterplay.
moves.15. Rxe8+: Now I pick up an additional Rook in the bargain. Black's incomplete development costs him, as if his B had cleared the line his Rooks would have been connected.
moves.16. Rae1: I plan to double Rooks on the last rank and force his last two pieces off the board.
moves.17. Rd8: The threat of 18 R/1-K8, winning a piece, prompts Black to resign.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C67), Berlin defence, Rio de Janeiro variation
